intro: Centaurea stenocephala, commonly known as narrow-headed centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, spiny leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces slender, bristly seed heads. Centaurea stenocephala is often found in open fields and along coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
